member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Models.AffinityGroupCapabilities
member.summary: Describes the capabilities associated with an affinity group.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Models.AffinityGroupCapabilities.PersistentVMRole
member.summary: Indicates if the virtual machine related operations can be performed in this affinity group. If so, the string PersistentVMRole will be returned by this element. Otherwise, this element will not be present.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Models.AffinityGroupCreateParameters
member.summary: Parameters supplied to the Create Affinity Group operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Models.AffinityGroupCreateParameters.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the AffinityGroupCreateParameters class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Models.AffinityGroupCreateParameters.Description
member.summary: Optional. A description for the affinity group. The description can be up to 1024 characters in length.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Models.AffinityGroupCreateParameters.Label
member.summary: Required. A base-64 encoded name for the affinity group. The name can be up to 100 characters in length. Its value defaults to the Name of the affinity group if not provided.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Models.AffinityGroupCreateParameters.Location
member.summary: Required. The data center location where the affinity group will be created. To list available locations, see the List Locations operation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Models.AffinityGroupCreateParameters.Name
member.summary: Required. A name for the affinity group that is unique to the subscription.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Models.OperationStatus
member.summary: The status of the asynchronous request.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Models.OperationStatus.InProgress
member.summary: The asynchronous request is in progress.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Models.OperationStatus.Succeeded
member.summary: The asynchronous request succeeded.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Models.OperationStatus.Failed
member.summary: The asynchronous request failed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Models.OperationStatusResponse
member.summary: The response body contains the status of the specified asynchronous operation, indicating whether it has succeeded, is inprogress, or has failed. Note that this status is distinct from the HTTP status code returned for the Get Operation Status operation itself. If the asynchronous operation succeeded, the response body includes the HTTP status code for the successful request. If the asynchronous operation failed, the response body includes the HTTP status code for the failed request, and also includes error information regarding the failure.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Models.OperationStatusResponse.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the OperationStatusResponse class.

member.summary: If the asynchronous operation failed, the response body includes the HTTP status code for the failed request, and also includes error information regarding the failure.

member.summary: The HTTP status code for the asynchronous request.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Models.OperationStatusResponse.Id
member.summary: The request ID of the asynchronous request. This value is returned in the x-ms-request-id response header of the asynchronous request.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Models.OperationStatusResponse.Status
member.summary: The status of the asynchronous request.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Models.SubscriptionListOperationsParameters
member.summary: Parameters supplied to the List Subscription Operations operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Models.SubscriptionListOperationsParameters.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the SubscriptionListOperationsParameters class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Models.SubscriptionListOperationsParameters.ContinuationToken
member.summary: Optional. When there are too many operations to list, such as when the requested timeframe is very large, the response includes an incomplete list and a token that can be used to return the rest of the list. Subsequent requests must include this parameter to continue listing operations from where the last response left off. If no token is specified, a filter is not applied and the response will begin at the specified StartTime.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Models.SubscriptionListOperationsParameters.EndTime
member.summary: Required. The end of the timeframe to begin listing subscription operations in UTC format. This parameter and the StartTime parameter indicate the timeframe to retrieve subscription operations.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Models.SubscriptionListOperationsParameters.ObjectIdFilter
member.summary: Optional. Returns subscription operations only for the specified object type and object ID. This parameter must be set equal to the URL value for performing an HTTP GET on the object. If no object is specified, a filter is not applied.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Models.SubscriptionListOperationsParameters.OperationStatus
member.summary: Optional. Returns subscription operations only for thespecified result status, either Succeeded, Failed, or InProgress.This filter can be combined with the ObjectIdFilter to selectsubscription operations for an object with a specific resultstatus. If no result status is specified, a filter is not applied.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Models.SubscriptionListOperationsParameters.StartTime
member.summary: Required. The start of the timeframe to begin listingsubscription operations in UTC format. This parameter and theEndTime parameter indicate the timeframe to retrieve subscription operations. This parameter cannot indicate a start date of more than 90 days in the past.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Models.SubscriptionListOperationsResponse
member.summary: The List Subscription Operations operation response.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Models.SubscriptionListOperationsResponse.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the SubscriptionListOperationsResponse class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Models.SubscriptionListOperationsResponse.ContinuationToken
member.summary: The string that can be used to return the rest of the list. Subsequent requests must include this parameter to continue listing operations from where the last response left off. This element exists only if the complete list of subscription operations was not returned.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Models.SubscriptionListOperationsResponse.SubscriptionOperations
member.summary: The list of operations that have been performed on the subscription during the specified timeframe.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Models.SubscriptionListOperationsResponse.OperationCallerDetails
member.summary: A collection of attributes that identifies the source of the operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Models.SubscriptionListOperationsResponse.OperationCallerDetails.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the OperationCallerDetails class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Models.SubscriptionListOperationsResponse.OperationCallerDetails.ClientIPAddress
member.summary: The IP address of the client computer that initiated the operation. This element is returned only if UsedServiceManagementApi is true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Models.SubscriptionListOperationsResponse.OperationCallerDetails.SubscriptionCertificateThumbprint
member.summary: The thumbprint of the subscription certificate used to initiate the operation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Models.SubscriptionListOperationsResponse.OperationCallerDetails.UsedServiceManagementApi
member.summary: Indicates whether the operation was initiated by using the Service Management API. False if it was initiated by another source, such as the Management Portal.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Models.SubscriptionListOperationsResponse.OperationCallerDetails.UserEmailAddress
member.summary: The email associated with the Windows Live ID of the user who initiated the operation from the Management Portal. This element is returned only if UsedServiceManagementApi is false.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Models.SubscriptionListOperationsResponse.SubscriptionOperation
member.summary: An operation that has been performed on the subscription during the specified timeframe.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Models.SubscriptionListOperationsResponse.SubscriptionOperation.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the SubscriptionOperation class.

member.summary: A collection of attributes that identifies the source of the operation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Models.SubscriptionListOperationsResponse.SubscriptionOperation.OperationCompletedTime
member.summary: The time that the operation finished executing.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Models.SubscriptionListOperationsResponse.SubscriptionOperation.OperationId
member.summary: The globally unique identifier (GUID) of the operation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Models.SubscriptionListOperationsResponse.SubscriptionOperation.OperationName
member.summary: The name of the performed operation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Models.SubscriptionListOperationsResponse.SubscriptionOperation.OperationObjectId
member.summary: The target object for the operation. This value is equal to the URL for performing an HTTP GET on the object, and corresponds to the same values for the ObjectIdFilter in the request.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Models.SubscriptionListOperationsResponse.SubscriptionOperation.OperationParameters
member.summary: The collection of parameters for the performed operation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Models.SubscriptionListOperationsResponse.SubscriptionOperation.OperationStartedTime
member.summary: The time that the operation started to execute.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Models.SubscriptionListOperationsResponse.SubscriptionOperation.OperationStatus
member.summary: An object that contains information on the current status of the operation. The object returned has the following XML format: 339c6c13-1f81-412f-9bc6-00e9c5876695 Succeeded 200 Possible values of the Status element, whichholds the operation status, are: Succeeded, Failed, InProgress.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Models.SubscriptionOperationNames
member.summary: The name of a subscription operation.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.Models.SubscriptionStatus
member.summary: The subscription status.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.IManagementClient
member.summary: The Service Management API provides programmatic access to much of the functionality available through the Management Portal. The Service Management API is a REST API. All API operations are performed over SSL and mutually authenticated using X.509 v3 certificates. (see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windowsazure/ee460799.aspx for more information)

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.IManagementClient.GetOperationStatusAsync(System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: The Get Operation Status operation returns the status of thespecified operation. After calling an asynchronous operation, you can call Get Operation Status to determine whether the operation has succeeded, failed, or is still in progress. (see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windowsazure/ee460783.aspx for more information)
member.param: The request ID for the request you wish to track. The request ID is returned in the x-ms-request-id response header for every request.
member.returns: The response body contains the status of the specified asynchronous operation, indicating whether it has succeeded, is inprogress, or has failed. Note that this status is distinct from the HTTP status code returned for the Get Operation Status operation itself. If the asynchronous operation succeeded, the response body includes the HTTP status code for the successful request. If the asynchronous operation failed, the response body includes the HTTP status code for the failed request, and also includes error information regarding the failure.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.IManagementClient.BaseUri
member.summary: The URI used as the base for all Service Management requests.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.IManagementClient.Credentials
member.summary: When you create a Windows Azure subscription, it is uniquely identified by a subscription ID. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every call that you make to the Service Management API. The Windows Azure Service ManagementAPI use mutual authentication of management certificates over SSL to ensure that a request made to the service is secure. No anonymous requests are allowed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.IManagementClient.AffinityGroups
member.summary: Operations for managing affinity groups beneath your subscription. (see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windowsazure/ee460798.aspx for more information)

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.IManagementClient.Locations
member.summary: The Service Management API includes operations for listing the available data center locations for a hosted service in your subscription. (see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windowsazure/gg441299.aspx for more information)

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.IManagementClient.ManagementCertificates
member.summary: You can use management certificates, which are also known as subscription certificates, to authenticate clients attempting to connect to resources associated with your Windows Azure subscription. (see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windowsazure/jj154124.aspx for more information)

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.ManagementClient.#ctor(Microsoft.WindowsAzure.SubscriptionCloudCredentials,System.Uri)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ManagementClient class.
member.param: When you create a Windows Azure subscription, it is uniquely identified by a subscription ID. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every call that you make to the Service Management API. The Windows Azure Service ManagementAPI use mutual authentication of management certificates over SSL to ensure that a request made to the service is secure. No anonymous requests are allowed.
The URI used as the base for all Service Management requests.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.ManagementClient.#ctor(Microsoft.WindowsAzure.SubscriptionCloudCredentials)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ManagementClient class.
member.param: When you create a Windows Azure subscription, it is uniquely identified by a subscription ID. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every call that you make to the Service Management API. The Windows Azure Service ManagementAPI use mutual authentication of management certificates over SSL to ensure that a request made to the service is secure. No anonymous requests are allowed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.ManagementClient.GetOperationStatusAsync(System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: The Get Operation Status operation returns the status of thespecified operation. After calling an asynchronous operation, you can call Get Operation Status to determine whether the operation has succeeded, failed, or is still in progress. (see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windowsazure/ee460783.aspx for more information)
member.param: The request ID for the request you wish to track. The request ID is returned in the x-ms-request-id response header for every request.
member.returns: The response body contains the status of the specified asynchronous operation, indicating whether it has succeeded, is inprogress, or has failed. Note that this status is distinct from the HTTP status code returned for the Get Operation Status operation itself. If the asynchronous operation succeeded, the response body includes the HTTP status code for the successful request. If the asynchronous operation failed, the response body includes the HTTP status code for the failed request, and also includes error information regarding the failure.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.ManagementClient.BaseUri
member.summary: The URI used as the base for all Service Management requests.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Management.ManagementClient.Credentials
member.summary: When you create a Windows Azure subscription, it is uniquely identified by a subscription ID. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every call that you make to the Service Management API. The Windows Azure Service ManagementAPI use mutual authentication of management certificates over SSL to ensure that a request made to the service is secure. No anonymous requests are allowed.

member.param: The name of the desired affinity group as returned by the name element of the List Affinity Groups operation.
